title: Nuesoft
text:
Nuesoft Technologies, Inc. is a health care <a href="software%20as%20a%20service">software as a service</a> (SaaS) company headquartered in <a href="Marietta%2C%20Georgia">Marietta, Georgia</a>, <a href="United%20States">USA</a>. The company develops and sells <a href="Medical%20practice%20management%20software">practice management software</a> for <a href="Medicine%23Clinical%20practice">physician practices</a>, <a href="College%20health">university health centers</a>, and <a href="Medical%20billing%20%28United%20States%29%23Role%20of%20the%20Medical%20Billing%20Service">medical billing companies</a>. The company operates a wholly owned medical billing clearinghouse and also provides <a href="HL7">HL7</a> product integration for <a href="Electronic%20medical%20record">EMR</a>/<a href="Electronic%20health%20record">EHR</a> systems, <a href="laboratory%20information%20system">laboratory information system</a>s, <a href="medical%20imaging">medical imaging</a> systems, and <a href="document%20management%20system">document management system</a>s.
Its flagship product, NueMD, is notable for being the first Internet-based, platform independent medical practice management software program.

History.
Nuesoft was founded as Persoft Technologies, Inc. in 1993 at the <a href="Georgia%20Institute%20of%20Technology">Georgia Institute of Technology</a>’s <a href="Advanced%20Technology%20Development%20Center">Advanced Technology Development Center</a> (ATDC). Later, in 1996, Persoft Technologies, Inc. changed its name to Nuesoft Technologies, Inc.
According to the reports, In October 2009, Nuesoft Technologies Inc launched NueMD electronic health record (EHR) 5.2 .
Patents.
Nuesoft holds several patents. The first patent awarded to the company details a system and method for providing look ahead socket generation. The second patent details an automated and scalable system for total real-time redundancy of a plurality of client-server systems.
Major sponsorships.
In 2010, Nuesoft became the sole sponsor of the <a href="Indian%20racquetball%20team">Indian racquetball team</a>. The financial support helped the team attend the 2010 World Racquetball Championships in Seoul, South Korea. Srikaran (Sri) Kandadai, a Nuesoft employee, was selected to represent the Indian National Racquetball team, prompting the company to become an official sponsor.
